system.description:
Children of Pilandok, the mouse-deer trickster god that stole the world from God.

(The stats provided here is for a Rank 1 encounter. Check the book for higher ranks.)
system.attacks:
Inflict Violence: Nick. Attack an enemy in range 3 with Faith, heal 1.

Gambits [[/r d6]]

1-2: Rush > Inflict Violence > Rush

3-4: Rush > Inflict Violence > Steal Agimat [1]: Steal an anting from an enemy in range 2. If they donâ€™t have an agimat, steal a Signature technique instead. They cannot benefit or use from the stolen thing until it is returned at the end of the Trickster's next riff.

5: Rush > Return Gift [2]: Teleport 1 and then all enemies in burst 4 suffer -2 Defense dice.

6: Rush > Inflict Violence > Steal Enlightenment [1]: Choose a fighter's Prowess and bring it down to 1 until the end of their next riff.

traits.name: Conviction
traits.description: All Folk have a reason for fighting, and if reasoned to, can cause them to rethink combat. However, they will fight for their Conviction until it looks like all is bleak.

traits.name: Morale
traits.description: At the beginning of any Resound where there are twice as many Kadungganan than there are enemies (eg., If there are 4 Kadungganan and 2 Enemies left) all Folk enemies will Surrender, becoming Defeated.

traits.name: Divine Striving
traits.description: Whenever a fighter falls to 0 HP, all Akayu fighters gain Striving until the end of their next riff. Their attacks gain Overwhelming and they have +1 to all Prowesses. When they lose Striving, they heal 2.

traits.name: Mock and Cackle
traits.description: When the trickster gains Striving, it and all allies in the field may teleport 1 and then all enemies adjacent to an akayu fighter are blown wide open.
